barchart.name: stackedBar
barchart.description:
The stacked barchart displays the abundances of the categories stacked for each sample.

You can choose to enable / disable normalisation, log scaling and select the sample label by metadata field.

Click a category to drill down to the next level. The layout tab has options to adjust the general layout of the graph.

adjust graph data.name: metadatum
adjust graph data.description: metadatum to name the datasets by
adjust graph data.title: metadatum

layout.name: items[1].parameters.labelRotation
layout.description: rotation of the labels in degrees
layout.title: label rotation

name: Phylum resolver
description:
The class level breakdown shows you the different classes for a specified phylum in a stacked bar-chart, using protein hit derived taxonomic information.

The data is normalized to allow comparison of different sized samples.

  • Use the input box below to select a different phylum.
  • Use the e-value cutoff to asses the quality of the hits.
  • If the data does not fit into the image, try the layout options.
  • To navigate, try clicking the breadcrumbs above the graph to go up and the bars in the graph to go down the hierarchy.
shortdescription: Class level breakdown of a phylum using protein hit derived taxonomic information.
author: MG-RAST
